wobani.resources.texture

Class StaticTexture

  • java.lang.Object
    • wobani.resources.texture.AbstractTexture
      • wobani.resources.texture.StaticTexture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource, ChangableColorSpace, EasyFiltering, Texture
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StaticCubeMapTexture, StaticTexture2D

    public abstract class StaticTexture
extends AbstractTexture
implements EasyFiltering, ChangableColorSpace
    Base class for static (loaded from file) textures.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface wobani.resources.texture.EasyFiltering

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface wobani.resources.texture.Texture

      • hddToRam

        protected abstract void hddToRam()
        Loads the texture's data from file to the RAM.

      • ramToVram

        protected abstract void ramToVram()
        Loads the texture's data from the RAM to the ACTION. It may cause errors if the data isn't in the RAM.

      • vramToRam

        protected abstract void vramToRam()
        Removes the texture's data from the ACTION. It may cause errors if the data isn't in the ACTION.

        @Bind
public void setTextureFiltering(@NotNull
                                       EasyFiltering.TextureFiltering tf)
        Sets the texture's filtering to the given value. Note that this method reloads the texture if the old or the new filtering mode is anisotropic.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        tf - texture's filtering mode
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - parameter can't be null

      • changeFiltering

        @Bind
protected void changeFiltering()
        Changes the texture's filtering mode based on the filtering field. It may cause errors if the data isn't in the ACTION.

      • getVramTimeLimit

        public long getVramTimeLimit()
        Returns the ACTION time limit. If the elapsed time since this texture's last use is higher than this value and the texture's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the texture's data may be removed from ACTION. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        ACTION time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setVramTimeLimit

        public void setVramTimeLimit(long vramTimeLimit)
        Sets the ACTION time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this texture's last use is higher than this value and the texture's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the texture's data may be removed from ACTION. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        vramTimeLimit - ACTION time limit (in miliseconds)

      • getRamTimeLimit

        public long getRamTimeLimit()
        Returns the RAM time limit. If the elapsed time since this texture's last use is higher than this value and the texture's data store policy is HDD, the texture's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        RAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setRamTimeLimit

        public void setRamTimeLimit(long ramTimeLimit)
        Sets the RAM time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this texture's last use is higher than this value and the texture's data store policy is HDD, the texture's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        ramTimeLimit - RAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • getLastActive

        public long getLastActive()
        Returns the time when the texture last time used.
        Returns:
        the time when the texture last time used (in miliseconds)

      • getState

        @NotNull
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getState()
        Returns the texture's state. It determines where the texture is currently stored.
        Returns:
        the texture's state

      • getDataStorePolicy

        @NotNull
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getDataStorePolicy()
        Returns the texture's data store policy. ACTION means that the texture's data will be stored in ACTION. RAM means that the texture's data may be removed from ACTION to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the texture's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM if it's rarely used. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        the texture's data store policy

      • setDataStorePolicy

        public void setDataStorePolicy(@NotNull
                               ResourceManager.ResourceState minState)
        Sets the texture's data store policy to the given value. ACTION means that the texture's data will be stored in ACTION. RAM means that the texture's data may be removed from ACTION to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the texture's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM if it's rarely used. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        minState - data store policy

      • issRgb

        public boolean issRgb()
        Description copied from interface: Texture
        Determines whether the texture is in sRGB color space.
        Specified by:
        issRgb in interface Texture
        Returns:
        true if the texture's color space is sRGB, false otherwise

      • isDefaultsRgb

        public boolean isDefaultsRgb()
        Returns the texture's default color space. It doesn't have to be the same as the texture's current color space. You can load sRGB color space textures in linear space if you want (eg. if you don't want to use gamma correction).
        Returns:
        the texture's default color space
        See Also:
        issRgb(), setsRgb(boolean sRgb)

      • setsRgb

        public void setsRgb(boolean sRgb)
        Sets whether or not the texture is in sRGB color space. You can load sRGB color space textures in linear space if you want (eg. if you don't want to use gamma correction). But you can't change a default linear color space texture to sRGB color space because it's always used in linear color space. Note that this method reloads the texture from file if the color space changes.
        Specified by:
        setsRgb in interface ChangableColorSpace
        Parameters:
        sRgb - sRGB

        Returns:

        public boolean isUsable()

        Determines wheter this resource is usable. If it returns false, you can't use if for anything.
